intro: Paramignya trimera, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom from spring to autumn. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Paramignya trimera is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its long blooming period.
